subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] FAQ?
msgSnippet: ... Well, since no one else answered, I will at least answer 1. There are fonts available if you go to the webpage of this list and then go to the files
messageBody:
delrayva wrote:
>
>
> Is there a FAQ for this group? I've been using QS for taking notes
> during meetings for about 4 years, but I've not participated much in
> this group.
>
> Here are some questions I'd like to see answered in a FAQ:
>
> 1. I'd like to type something in QS, what font do I need?
>
> 2. Is there a standard way of associating characters I type on a
> keyboard with QS letters?
>
> 3. How do I post something to the group in QS?
>
> 4. When people type in QS, it just shows up as roman letters on my
> screen, what am I doing wrong?
>
> 5. How do you recite the QS alphabet? Are there standard names or a
> standard order for the letters?
>
> As much as I want answers to these questions, I'd even more like to
> see a FAQ stood up for this group, to make it a bit more newby-friendly.
>
> Thanks,
> Deed Ed Loll Roar Age Valve Eat Age
> /delrEvIE

Well, since no one else answered, I will at least answer 1. There are
fonts available if you go to the webpage of this list and then go to the
files section. I have had not problem getting the fonts to work on both
a Macintosh and a linux machine. Since others use Windows, I imagine
there is little problem getting them to work in Windows, either.

The topic of posting QS came up on this list about a year ago. I know
because I read the emails in the archives. I just joined the group
myself a few weeks ago. It would be nice to communicate on this mailing
list in QS, but I don't know how easy that is to accomplish. We should
be working towards that goal. For now I have my hands full with my
alphabet project.

Maybe if you get the answers to the rest of the questions you could
write the FAQ yourself?
